intro: Leptorumohra miqueliana var. narawensis, commonly known as the Narawen's leptorumohra, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture and a distinct aromatic scent. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
